steps: Power off computer and unplug power cable completely
Press power button for 10 seconds to discharge capacitors
Remove side panel screws and slide off side panel
Put on anti-static wrist strap and ground to case
Identify component requiring maintenance or replacement
Disconnect power cables and data cables from component
Remove mounting screws or brackets holding component
Install replacement component ensuring proper seating
Apply thermal paste if working with CPU or GPU
Reconnect all power and data cables securely
Organize cables with cable ties for proper airflow
Replace side panel and secure with screws
Power on and check all components function properly
warnings: Always ground yourself before touching internal components
Ensure power supply is completely disconnected
Handle RAM modules by edges only to avoid damage
Graphics cards are heavy - support them during installation
CPU installation requires extreme care to avoid bent pins
Check component compatibility before purchasing replacements
Modern components can be damaged by static electricity
